benchmark_details.name: OpenBench: A New Benchmark and Baseline for Semantic Navigation
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces a new benchmark specifically designed for outdoor navigation in residential areas, reflecting the real-world challenges faced by autonomous delivery systems.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to enhance the interactivity, ease of deployment, and long-term reliability of navigation systems in last-mile delivery contexts.

metrics: Long-term Success Weighted by Path Length (LSPL)
methodology.calculation: Metrics are defined based on the ability of the system to complete tasks accurately and efficiently over time.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in metrics indicate better performance in task planning and navigation efficiency.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments in simulated and real-world environments validate the proposed systemâ€™s effectiveness in last-mile delivery.
